description: Follow reaction as France beat Brazil at the Women's World Cup.
title: Fifa Women's World Cup LIVE: Watch France vs Brazil score, commentary & updates from Group F game
title_page: Fifa Women's World Cup LIVE: Watch France vs Brazil score, commentary & updates from Group F game - BBC Sport
maintext:
Thanks and goodbye
FT: France 2-1 Brazil
That's the end of this match, with Panama v Jamaica starting in 10 minutes.
You can follow updates from that one here.
Thanks for joining us and bye for now.
Renard heads late winner as France beat Brazil - read the report
FT: France 2-1 Brazil
Emma Smith
BBC Sport at Brisbane Stadium
Captain Wendie Renard headed a late winner as France beat Brazil in a thrilling game in Brisbane at the 2023 Fifa Women's World Cup.
Eugenie le Sommer put the French ahead after 17 minutes, before Debinha pulled Brazil level in the second half.
But Renard - who had been an injury doubt - headed in the decisive goal with seven minutes to go.
There was end to end action as two of the pre-tournament favourites delivered a game which lived up to expectations.
Brazil would have qualified for the last 16 with victory but instead must wait until the final matchday to try to book a spot.
Pia Sundhage's side meet Jamaica in their final group match, while France take on Panama. Both games will be played on 2 August, kicking off at 11.00 BST.
Click here to read the full report.
Post
FT: France 2-1 Brazil
Emma Smith
BBC Sport at Brisbane Stadium
Herve Renard was absolutely livid at the award of that late free-kick and had to be restrained by his coaching staff.
He was screaming at everyone in the vicinity, including Pia Sundhage who looked like she gave a bit back.
At the end, he refused initially to shake hands with the Brazil staff, before eventually going to briefly do the courtesies.
Contrasting emotions
FT: France 2-1 Brazil
Andy Gray
BBC Sport at Brisbane Stadium
French players fall to their knees as the bench runs onto the pitch. That was a monumental effort.
In contrast, the Brazilians look dejected as the full-time whistle blows.
You wouldn't think it's only the second round of matches with those reactions, but that feels like a big, big win for this French side.
